content: Hi,I am looking for reliable email service provider like mailchimp but paid with crpypto.Is there any good software to send bulk emails cheap and without problems and not going to spam?ThanksBRG

comments.author: AB de Royse777
comments.body: Quote from: gondel on December 25, 2022, 02:58:07 PMHi,I am looking for reliable email service provider like mailchimp but paid with crpypto.Is there any good software to send bulk emails cheap and without problems and not going to spam?Mailchimp, getresponse, Aweber are the auto responders I used in the past but all of them had fiat payments back then. They are one of the best in the industry too. Check this site https://crypto.news/top-5-emailing-services-that-support-crypto/The author mentioned Aweber with other four but I checked Aweber payment method and could not find an option to pay with crypto yet. Maybe I am missing something in the process.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: gondel on December 25, 2022, 02:58:07 PMHi,I am looking for reliable email service provider like mailchimp but paid with crpypto.Is there any good software to send bulk emails cheap and without problems and not going to spam?ThanksBRGThrough my research, I found that most marketing email sites accept payment by credit cards or PayPal, so if you want to pay via crypto, I have an idea, which is to transfer your crypto to the PYYPl application and create a free Mastercard that you top-up with crypto and buy with this card any service online, the email marketing sites that I recommend are GetResponse, Sendinblue, ActiveCampaign, and Drip. I advise you to try the free plan on one of these sites first to see the features that suit you, each of these sites has different prices you can choose and pay according to your monthly or annual budget.[1] https://www.pyypl.com/

comments.author: gondel
comments.body: Thanks for the replies, It looks like none of the email service providers from this article are not accepting crypto, strange why the article was being made at all.Transfering to thi payment processor is all the same as ending to revolut and then get virtual credit card wit hthem, which involves KYC etc.I need a provider which is crypto friendly.Thanks

comments.author: fortunecrypto
comments.body: Quote from: gondel on December 25, 2022, 09:59:33 PMThanks for the replies, It looks like none of the email service providers from this article are not accepting crypto, strange why the article was being made at all.Transfering to thi payment processor is all the same as ending to revolut and then get virtual credit card wit hthem, which involves KYC etc.I need a provider which is crypto friendly.ThanksWhen it comes to email services the service provider wants to know who they are dealing with and for what purposes which is why they use credit cards and Paypal, email providers have strict compliance on where to use their service and there are so many Crypto projects that involve in a scam and bulk email sending if you are going to use their service you will notice that they are asking for a physical address for every newsletter that they are going to send, its part of the compliance and some Cryptocurrency projects may opt not to give this information.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: gondel on December 25, 2022, 02:58:07 PMI am looking for reliable email service provider like mailchimp but paid with crpypto.Is there any good software to send bulk emails cheap and without problems and not going to spam?I couldn't find any reliable service that accepts cryptocurrency payments, but maybe it's best to run your own service and reduce risk of getting hacked, and nobody could ban you like Malichimp did.After doing some research I found something that I didn't test myself, but you could try these open source alternatives that are free like ListMonk or Mailtrain:https://listmonk.app/https://github.com/Mailtrain-org/mailtrainEDIT:I did found few email marketing services that accept Bitcoin and other crypto, but I can't say how good or reliable they are, so better do your own research:https://cryptwerk.com/companies/email-marketing/
